BBC on the scene of the Hong Kong apartment block blaze At least 44 people have been killed in the fire, which took local authorities 18 hours to bring under control. 7 days ago Asia Japanese 'One Piece' singer stopped mid-show after China-Japan feud The sudden cancellation of Japanese events in Shanghai have sparked criticism and fanned nationalist sentiment. 3 days ago Asia Hong Kong fire death toll rises to 146 as thousands pay respects Authorities say they have completed searches of four of the seven towers as part of a criminal investigation. 4 days ago Asia Three days of mourning begin after Hong Kong's deadliest fire in decades At least 128 people have died and hundreds remain unaccounted for following the fire which engulfed several tower blocks. 5 days ago Asia Features What we know about the Hong Kong apartment fires As the last flames are extinguished, many are now asking who is to blame for the deadly blaze. 'This was preventable': Anger and unanswered questions after Hong Kong fire Questions are mounting as to how the deadly fire spread so rapidly - and who should be held responsible. China's investment spree in UK gave it access to military-grade technology, BBC told Tens of billions of pounds has been spent by the Chinese in the UK since 2000, Panorama has learned. A Chinese firm bought an insurer for CIA agents - part of Beijing's trillion dollar spending spree When an insurer for FBI and CIA agents was sold to a Chinese entity, it led the US to tighten investment laws. What to know about China and Japan's escalating spat over Taiwan Japanese PM Sanae Takaichi had suggested Tokyo could take military action if Beijing attacked Taiwan. Latest updates 14 hrs ago 'My heart breaks every time I'm called a hero' - Hong Kong fire survivor A survivor tells the BBC he feels guilty he didn't save more people from the blaze at his block of flats. 14 hrs ago 22 hrs ago Hong Kong orders removal of scaffolding mesh after deadly blaze Investigations continue into a fire last week at the Wang Fuk Court housing complex, which killed at least 159 people. 22 hrs ago 24 hrs ago Production halted at Chinese factory making 'childlike' sex dolls The issue is in the spotlight after Shein announced a global ban on the sale of sex dolls with a childlike appearance. 24 hrs ago 1 day ago The controversy over the collapsed China spy case explained The government is facing questions about why the case collapsed just weeks before a trial was due to go ahead. 1 day ago 2 days ago MPs warn China spy trial failures could happen again A damning report finds a “shambolic” system could lead to future espionage cases being dropped. 2 days ago 2 days ago Chinese and Japanese boats face off near disputed islands as feud worsens Each side claims to have fended off an incursion in the disputed waters near Taiwan. 2 days ago 2 days ago Devastating toxic spill seen as test of whether African countries will stand up to China Chinese companies provide jobs and much needed revenue in Zambia, where the disaster took place. 2 days ago 2 days ago Hong Kong leader orders investigation into deadly fire that killed 151 The fire is the deadliest the city has seen in more than 70 years. 2 days ago 3 days ago Japanese 'One Piece' singer stopped mid-show after China-Japan feud The sudden cancellation of Japanese events in Shanghai have sparked criticism and fanned nationalist sentiment. 3 days ago ...
